title: Abstract Wiki Frame: Relational relation bundle

frame_type.description: Stable string label used by routers / planners to recognize this as a relation-bundle frame.

subject.description: Entity about which the bundle of facts is stated (city, country, organization, person, etc.). Shape follows semantics.types.Entity.

items.description: List of RelationBundleItem entries, each wrapping a more specific relational frame together with a coarse type and optional salience / ordering hints.

relation_type.description: Coarse label describing the kind of relation, used for ordering and planning heuristics (e.g. 'definition', 'classification', 'attribute', 'quantitative', 'membership', 'part_whole', 'location', 'role').

relation.description: Underlying relation object. Typically one of the specific relational frames (membership, quantitative measure, etc.).

salience.description: Optional numeric score indicating importance of this relation within the bundle. Higher = more important.

order_hint.description: Optional integer suggesting preferred ordering among relations of similar type. Lower values are typically placed earlier.

info_structure.description: Optional information-structure annotation (topic/focus/background hints for subject vs. predicate roles). Shape follows semantics.normalization.InfoStructure.

attributes.description: Open-ended attribute map for bundle-level metadata useful to downstream components (e.g. 'max_items_per_sentence', 'preferred_pattern').

extra.description: Free-form metadata preserved but not interpreted by core NLG logic (e.g. original IDs, provenance, pipeline-debug info).
